definitions.body: wormwood (NH id.; Ar. la9nun is curse (vb. la9ana id.), so Nab. [[לחנת]] (vb. [[לען]]) cf. Cook:Gloss.);—only fig. of bitter things:—of perverted justice, Am 5:7, Am 6:12 (‖[[ראׁשׁ]]; of result of idolatry, De 29:17 (‖ id.); of ´[[י]]'s chastisement Je 9:14 (‖[[מֵי־ראׁשׁ]]), Je 23:15 (‖ id.), La 3:15 (‖[[מְרוֹרִים]]), v:La 3:19 (‖[[ראׁשׁ]]); sim. of bitter ([[מָרָה]]) result of intercourse with strange woman Pr 5:4.—On wormwood (Artemisia absinthium, etc., Gk. a)yi/qion) cf. Löw:80f. 401, 421 Tristr:Nat, Hist. Bib. 493.
